tool_input.subject: Phase 1: Remove unused packages + PWA
tool_input.description: Remove next-pwa, next-auth, preact signals, react-tailwindcss-datepicker, crypto, langchain. Delete dead files. Clean imports. Remove PWA from next.config.mjs.

tool_input.subject: Phase 2: Upgrade Next.js + React
tool_input.description: Upgrade next, react, react-dom, eslint-config-next, @types/react, @types/react-dom. Update next.config.mjs. Handle async params.

tool_input.subject: Phase 3: Upgrade tRPC v10→v11 + React Query v4→v5
tool_input.description: Upgrade tRPC and React Query packages. Move transformer to links. Replace useContext→useUtils. Replace isLoading→isPending for mutations.

tool_input.subject: Phase 4: Upgrade framer-motion → motion
tool_input.description: Swap framer-motion for motion package. Update imports in 8 files.

tool_input.subject: Phase 5: Upgrade react-day-picker v8→v9
tool_input.description: Upgrade react-day-picker. Rewrite calendar.tsx with v9 API changes.

tool_input.subject: Phase 6: Upgrade remaining packages
tool_input.description: Upgrade date-fns, drizzle, hookform resolvers, clerk, radix, and all minor/patch deps. Update drizzle-kit CLI commands.

tool_input.subject: Phase 7: Verify + build check
tool_input.description: Run bun run build && bun run lint to verify everything works.

- Migrate framer-motion→motion (v12)
- Upgrade react-day-picker v8→v9

tool_input.description: Check if PR exists for app-dir branch
See all commits on app-dir not in main

tool_input.command:
gh pr create --title "App Dir migration + package upgrades" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
- Complete App Router migration with three-layer architecture (Repository → Service → Router/Action)
- Upgrade all packages to latest stable versions to fix Vercel CVE deployment block

## Package Upgrades
- **Next.js** 15.3 → 16.1 (fixes CVE blocking Vercel deploy)
- **tRPC** v10 → v11, **React Query** v4 → v5
- **framer-motion** → **motion** v12
- **react-day-picker** v8 → v9
- **date-fns** v2 → v4, **drizzle-orm/kit** latest, **@hookform/resolvers** v3 → v5
- Removed unused: next-pwa, next-auth, langchain, preact signals, pwa-asset-generator

## Architecture Changes
- Repository layer (`src/data/*.repository.ts`) for pure data access
- Service layer (`src/services/*.service.ts`) for business logic + transactions
- Server actions (`src/actions/*.actions.ts`) with revalidation
- tRPC routers thinned to call services
- New Postgres schema (`schema-postgres.ts`) with Neon/Vercel Postgres
- Responsive dialog/drawer components (Shadcn UI)

## Code Migration
- `useContext()` → `useUtils()`, `isLoading` → `isPending` across all components
- `framer-motion` → `motion/react` imports
- Calendar component rewritten for react-day-picker v9 API
- `initialFocus` → `autoFocus` on all calendar usages
- Drizzle-kit CLI commands updated for latest version
- Lint script updated (`eslint src` since Next.js 16 removed `next lint`)

## Test Plan
- [x] `bun run build` passes
- [x] `bun run lint` passes
- [ ] Vercel deployment succeeds (CVE resolved)
- [ ] Dev server starts without errors
- [ ] tRPC queries/mutations work (flock CRUD, logging, expenses)
- [ ] Calendar/date picker renders correctly
- [ ] Animations work (motion migration)
EOF
)" --base main --head app-dir 2>&1

tool_input.prompt:
In /Users/joshnewton/Development/chicken-tracker-t3, explore the web app's user-facing features comprehensively. I need to understand:

1. **All app screens/pages** - What pages exist under `src/app/app/` and `src/app/(site)/`? What does each page do? Read the page.tsx files and key client components.

2. **Core features** - What CRUD operations exist? What data models are involved? Read through the tRPC routers in `src/server/trpc/router/` to understand all API endpoints.

3. **UI components** - What are the main interactive components? Modals, forms, charts, etc. Check `src/components/` directory structure.

4. **Auth flow** - How does Clerk auth work? Read `src/middleware.ts` and auth-related files.

5. **Data visualization** - Any charts or statistics displays? Check for chart.js usage.

Be very thorough - I need a complete feature inventory to plan a React Native app.

In /Users/joshnewton/Development/chicken-tracker-t3, explore the data layer and API surface in detail:

1. **Database schema** - Read `src/lib/db/schema-postgres.ts` and `src/lib/db/schema.ts` to understand all tables and relationships.

2. **Services layer** - Read all files in `src/services/*.service.ts` to understand business logic.

3. **Server actions** - Read all files in `src/actions/*.actions.ts` to understand what server-side mutations exist.

4. **Public API routes** - Read all files in `src/app/api/` to understand REST endpoints (especially eggs endpoints for Home Assistant).

5. **tRPC routers** - Read `src/server/trpc/router/_app.ts` and all individual routers to map the complete API surface.

6. **Repository layer** - Read `src/data/*.repository.ts` to understand data access patterns.

I need the full API surface and data model to plan which parts of the backend a React Native app can reuse vs what needs to change.

questions.question: Which React Native framework do you want to use?

options.label: Expo (Recommended)
options.description: Managed workflow with easy builds, OTA updates, and less native config. Best for apps that don't need heavy native modules.

options.label: Bare React Native
options.description: Full control over native code. More setup but maximum flexibility for native integrations.

questions.question: How should the mobile app talk to your backend?

options.label: tRPC client (Recommended)
options.description: Reuse existing tRPC routers directly. Type-safe, minimal backend changes. Uses @trpc/client + React Query.

options.label: New REST API layer
options.description: Build dedicated REST endpoints for mobile. More work but decouples mobile from tRPC.

options.label: Shared monorepo
options.description: Put web + mobile in a turborepo/monorepo, share types, services, and tRPC router definitions.

questions.question: Should the React Native app live in this repo or a new one?

options.label: New separate repo
options.description: Clean separation. Mobile app is standalone, calls the deployed API.

options.label: Same repo (monorepo)
options.description: Share types and contracts. More complex setup but better type safety across web + mobile.

questions.question: Which screens are MVP priority for the mobile app?

options.label: Core only
options.description: Flocks list, flock detail, log eggs, log expenses, view stats/charts. Skip breeding, tasks, notifications.

options.label: Full feature parity
options.description: All screens from the web app including tasks, notifications, breeding planner, settings.

options.label: Core + notifications
options.description: Core features plus push notifications for tasks and summaries.

tool_input.prompt:
Design a plan for adding an Expo React Native app to an existing Next.js monorepo with these constraints:

**Current Stack:**
- Next.js 16 App Router web app at repo root
- tRPC v11 with React Query v5 for API
- Clerk for authentication
- Drizzle ORM with Vercel Postgres
- Chart.js for data visualization
- motion (framer-motion successor) for animations
- Tailwind CSS for styling

**Decisions Made:**
- Expo managed workflow
- tRPC client connecting to existing tRPC routers (reuse backend)
- Same repo as monorepo (turborepo or similar)
- Full feature parity with web app

**Key Questions to Address:**
1. **Monorepo structure**: How to organize? Turborepo? What goes in shared packages vs app-specific?
2. **tRPC sharing**: How to share the AppRouter type between web and mobile? Create a shared `packages/api` or `packages/trpc`?
3. **Clerk mobile auth**: Clerk has `@clerk/clerk-expo` - how does this integrate with the existing Clerk setup?
4. **Navigation**: React Navigation or Expo Router for mobile? Map all web routes to mobile screens.
5. **UI framework**: NativeWind (Tailwind for RN) or something else? How to handle the existing Tailwind design system?
6. **Charts**: react-native-chart-kit or victory-native to replace Chart.js?
7. **Image uploads**: Firebase Storage uploads exist in web - how to handle in mobile?
8. **Calendar/Date picker**: What replaces react-day-picker on mobile?
9. **Build/Deploy**: EAS Build for iOS/Android distribution?

**Screens to implement (full parity):**
- Flocks list (home)
- Flock detail (dashboard with charts, breeds, tasks)
- Flock edit
- Flock summary (monthly report)
- Log eggs modal
- Log expense modal
- Breed add/edit modal
- All logs (paginated list)
- All expenses (paginated list)
- Tasks management
- Notifications
- Settings (Clerk profile)
- Breeding planner
- Marketing/landing (or skip for mobile?)

**Shared code opportunities:**
- tRPC router types (AppRouter)
- Zod validation schemas
- Date utility functions
- Type definitions (User, Flock, Breed, EggLog, Expense, Task, Notification)

Design a detailed, phased implementation plan.

tool_input.description: List app directory for route structure
List DB directory for schema files

tool_input.content:
# React Native (Expo) App Plan for FlockNerd

## Overview
Add an Expo React Native app to the existing repo as a monorepo (Turborepo + bun workspaces). The mobile app connects to the existing tRPC backend, shares types/schemas, and achieves full feature parity with the web app.

---

## Phase 0: Monorepo Conversion

**Goal**: Restructure into Turborepo without breaking the existing web app.

**New structure:**
```
chicken-tracker-t3/
  turbo.json
  package.json              (workspace root)
  apps/
    web/                    (existing Next.js app, MOVED from root)
    mobile/                 (NEW Expo app)
  packages/
    api/                    (shared tRPC AppRouter type + client helpers)
    shared/                 (types, Zod schemas, date-utils, constants)
```

**Steps:**
1. Create `turbo.json`, root `package.json` with `"workspaces": ["apps/*", "packages/*"]`
2. Move existing app into `apps/web/` (all source, configs, public dir)
3. Update `apps/web/package.json` paths and verify `bun run dev` and `bun run build` still work
4. **Build check before proceeding**

**Files to move to `apps/web/`:**
- `src/`, `public/`, `prisma/`, `next.config.mjs`, `tsconfig.json`, `tailwind.config.cjs`, `postcss.config.cjs`, `drizzle.config.ts`, `.env`, `.eslintrc.json`

---

## Phase 1: Shared Packages

### packages/api
- Re-export `AppRouter` type from `apps/web/src/server/trpc/router/_app.ts`
- Export `RouterInputs`, `RouterOutputs` type helpers
- Provide `createTRPCReact<AppRouter>()` for both platforms

### packages/shared
- **types.ts** — Standalone TS interfaces: `User`, `Flock`, `Breed`, `EggLog`, `Expense`, `Task`, `Notification`
- **schemas.ts** — Extract Zod schemas from tRPC routers (createBreed, createLog, createExpense, createTask, etc.)
- **date-utils.ts** — `formatDate`, `handleTimezone`, `setStartOfDay`
- **constants.ts** — Design tokens (colors), expense categories, recurrence options
- **chart-utils.ts** — Pure JS helpers: `createChartArray`, `calcDailyAverage`, `getDatesInRange`

---

## Phase 2: Expo App Scaffold

### 2.1 Initialize
```bash
cd apps && bunx create-expo-app mobile --template tabs
```
Expo SDK 52+ with Expo Router (file-based routing).

### 2.2 Core Dependencies
| Purpose | Package |
|---------|---------|
| Auth | `@clerk/clerk-expo`, `expo-secure-store` |
| API | `@trpc/client`, `@trpc/react-query`, `@tanstack/react-query`, `superjson` |
| Forms | `react-hook-form`, `@hookform/resolvers`, `zod` |
| Styling | `nativewind`, `tailwindcss` |
| Charts | `victory-native`, `react-native-svg` |
| Animation | `react-native-reanimated` |
| Images | `expo-image-picker`, `expo-image`, `expo-file-system` |
| Date picking | `react-native-calendars` or `@react-native-community/datetimepicker` |
| Toasts | `burnt` |
| Icons | `@expo/vector-icons` |
| Bottom sheets | `@gorhom/bottom-sheet` |
| Dates | `date-fns` |

### 2.3 Clerk Auth Setup
```typescript
// apps/mobile/app/_layout.tsx
<ClerkProvider publishableKey={EXPO_PUBLIC_CLERK_KEY} tokenCache={tokenCache}>
  <ClerkLoaded>
    <TRPCProvider><Slot /></TRPCProvider>
  </ClerkLoaded>
</ClerkProvider>
```

### 2.4 tRPC Client
Pass Clerk Bearer token in headers so existing `getAuth(req)` on the server works:
```typescript
httpBatchLink({
  transformer: superjson,
  url: `${API_URL}/api/trpc`,
  async headers() {
    const token = await getToken();
    return { Authorization: token ? `Bearer ${token}` : '' };
  },
})
```

### 2.5 Navigation (Expo Router)
```
apps/mobile/app/
  _layout.tsx                 Root (Clerk + tRPC providers)
  (auth)/
    sign-in.tsx
    sign-up.tsx
  (app)/
    (tabs)/
      _layout.tsx             Bottom tabs: Home | Logs | Expenses | Settings
      index.tsx               Flocks list
      logs.tsx                All logs
      expenses.tsx            All expenses
      settings.tsx            Profile
    flocks/[flockId]/
      index.tsx               Flock dashboard
      edit.tsx                Edit flock
      summary.tsx             Monthly summary
      breeding.tsx            Breeding planner
    notifications.tsx
```

---

## Phase 3: Core Screens

### 3.1 Flocks List (Home)
- `trpc.flocks.getFlocks.useQuery()` → `FlatList` with flock cards
- "Add Flock" FAB → form bottom sheet
- Tap flock → `flocks/[flockId]`

### 3.2 Flock Detail (Dashboard)
- Replicate `useFlockDataAppDir` hook: 4 parallel tRPC queries
- ScrollView: Stats cards → Production chart → Expense chart → Breeds → Tasks
- FABs for "Log Eggs" and "Log Expense"

### 3.3 Charts (victory-native)
- **ProductionChart** → `VictoryLine` + target average overlay, 7/15/30 day range selector
- **ExpenseChart** → `VictoryStack` (bars by category) + `VictoryLine` overlay, 6/9/12 month selector
- Chart data helpers extracted to `packages/shared/chart-utils.ts`

### 3.4 Log Eggs Modal
- Bottom sheet with date picker, numeric count input, breed selector, notes
- `trpc.logs.createLog.useMutation()` + `trpc.useUtils()` invalidation

### 3.5 Log Expense Modal
- Bottom sheet with date picker, currency input, category picker, memo
- `trpc.expenses.createExpense.useMutation()`

### 3.6 Breed Add/Edit
- `react-hook-form` + `expo-image-picker` → Firebase Storage upload
- `trpc.breeds.createBreed/updateBreed/deleteBreed.useMutation()`

### 3.7 All Logs & All Expenses
- `FlatList` with pagination, flock filter, swipe-to-delete

---

## Phase 4: Secondary Screens

| Screen | Key Details |
|--------|-------------|
| Flock Edit | Form + image upload + delete with confirmation |
| Flock Summary | Monthly stats, `react-native-view-shot` for sharing |
| Tasks | Today/upcoming toggle, mark complete, recurring support |
| Notifications | List with mark-as-read, unread badge on header icon |
| Settings | Clerk UserProfile or custom via `useUser()` |
| Breeding Planner | Bird profiles, pair manager, pedigree tree (`react-native-svg`) |

Skip: Landing/marketing pages (web-only)

---

## Phase 5: Server-Side Changes

### CORS Headers
Update `apps/web/src/app/api/trpc/[trpc]/route.ts`:
- Add CORS headers: `Access-Control-Allow-Origin`, `Allow-Methods`, `Allow-Headers`
- Add OPTIONS handler for preflight requests

### Auth Verification
- Verify `getAuth(req)` works with Bearer tokens from Expo
- Fallback: `verifyToken()` from `@clerk/backend` if needed

---

## Phase 6: Build & Deploy

- **EAS Build**: `eas.json` with dev/preview/production profiles
- **Env vars**: `EXPO_PUBLIC_CLERK_PUBLISHABLE_KEY`, `EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL`, Firebase config
- **Distribution**: Dev client → TestFlight/internal → App Store + Google Play
- **OTA Updates**: EAS Update for JS bundle changes

---

## Component Mapping (Web → Mobile)

| Web | Mobile |
|-----|--------|
| Radix Dialog / Vaul Drawer | `@gorhom/bottom-sheet` |
| Radix Select | `@react-native-picker/picker` |
| react-day-picker | `react-native-calendars` |
| chart.js | `victory-native` |
| next/image | `expo-image` |
| next/link | Expo Router `Link` |
| react-hot-toast | `burnt` |
| motion | `react-native-reanimated` |
| react-icons | `@expo/vector-icons` |
| html-to-image | `react-native-view-shot` |
| Tailwind CSS | NativeWind v4 |

---

## Design Tokens (shared)
```
Primary:    #385968
Secondary:  #84A8A3
Tertiary:   #CD7660
Accent1:    #e76f51
Accent2:    #e9c46a
Background: #FEF9F6
```

---

## Implementation Order
1. Phase 0 — Monorepo conversion (verify web still works)
2. Phase 1 — Shared packages
3. Phase 2 — Expo scaffold + auth + tRPC connection
4. Phase 5 — CORS + auth server changes
5. Phase 3.1-3.2 — Flocks list + flock detail (no charts yet)
6. Phase 3.3 — Charts with victory-native
7. Phase 3.4-3.7 — Modals + paginated lists
8. Phase 4 — All secondary screens
9. Phase 6 — EAS build + deploy

---

## Verification
- Web app still builds and deploys after monorepo conversion
- Mobile app authenticates via Clerk
- tRPC queries return data from mobile → server
- All CRUD operations work (flock, log, expense, breed, task)
- Charts render with real data
- Image uploads work via Firebase Storage
- EAS builds succeed for iOS and Android

tool_input.plan:
# React Native (Expo) App Plan for FlockNerd

## Overview
Add an Expo React Native app to the existing repo as a monorepo (Turborepo + bun workspaces). The mobile app connects to the existing tRPC backend, shares types/schemas, and achieves full feature parity with the web app.

---

## Phase 0: Monorepo Conversion

**Goal**: Restructure into Turborepo without breaking the existing web app.

**New structure:**
```
chicken-tracker-t3/
  turbo.json
  package.json              (workspace root)
  apps/
    web/                    (existing Next.js app, MOVED from root)
    mobile/                 (NEW Expo app)
  packages/
    api/                    (shared tRPC AppRouter type + client helpers)
    shared/                 (types, Zod schemas, date-utils, constants)
```

**Steps:**
1. Create `turbo.json`, root `package.json` with `"workspaces": ["apps/*", "packages/*"]`
2. Move existing app into `apps/web/` (all source, configs, public dir)
3. Update `apps/web/package.json` paths and verify `bun run dev` and `bun run build` still work
4. **Build check before proceeding**

**Files to move to `apps/web/`:**
- `src/`, `public/`, `prisma/`, `next.config.mjs`, `tsconfig.json`, `tailwind.config.cjs`, `postcss.config.cjs`, `drizzle.config.ts`, `.env`, `.eslintrc.json`

---

## Phase 1: Shared Packages

### packages/api
- Re-export `AppRouter` type from `apps/web/src/server/trpc/router/_app.ts`
- Export `RouterInputs`, `RouterOutputs` type helpers
- Provide `createTRPCReact<AppRouter>()` for both platforms

### packages/shared
- **types.ts** — Standalone TS interfaces: `User`, `Flock`, `Breed`, `EggLog`, `Expense`, `Task`, `Notification`
- **schemas.ts** — Extract Zod schemas from tRPC routers (createBreed, createLog, createExpense, createTask, etc.)
- **date-utils.ts** — `formatDate`, `handleTimezone`, `setStartOfDay`
- **constants.ts** — Design tokens (colors), expense categories, recurrence options
- **chart-utils.ts** — Pure JS helpers: `createChartArray`, `calcDailyAverage`, `getDatesInRange`

---

## Phase 2: Expo App Scaffold

### 2.1 Initialize
```bash
cd apps && bunx create-expo-app mobile --template tabs
```
Expo SDK 52+ with Expo Router (file-based routing).

### 2.2 Core Dependencies
| Purpose | Package |
|---------|---------|
| Auth | `@clerk/clerk-expo`, `expo-secure-store` |
| API | `@trpc/client`, `@trpc/react-query`, `@tanstack/react-query`, `superjson` |
| Forms | `react-hook-form`, `@hookform/resolvers`, `zod` |
| Styling | `nativewind`, `tailwindcss` |
| Charts | `victory-native`, `react-native-svg` |
| Animation | `react-native-reanimated` |
| Images | `expo-image-picker`, `expo-image`, `expo-file-system` |
| Date picking | `react-native-calendars` or `@react-native-community/datetimepicker` |
| Toasts | `burnt` |
| Icons | `@expo/vector-icons` |
| Bottom sheets | `@gorhom/bottom-sheet` |
| Dates | `date-fns` |

### 2.3 Clerk Auth Setup
```typescript
// apps/mobile/app/_layout.tsx
<ClerkProvider publishableKey={EXPO_PUBLIC_CLERK_KEY} tokenCache={tokenCache}>
  <ClerkLoaded>
    <TRPCProvider><Slot /></TRPCProvider>
  </ClerkLoaded>
</ClerkProvider>
```

### 2.4 tRPC Client
Pass Clerk Bearer token in headers so existing `getAuth(req)` on the server works:
```typescript
httpBatchLink({
  transformer: superjson,
  url: `${API_URL}/api/trpc`,
  async headers() {
    const token = await getToken();
    return { Authorization: token ? `Bearer ${token}` : '' };
  },
})
```

### 2.5 Navigation (Expo Router)
```
apps/mobile/app/
  _layout.tsx                 Root (Clerk + tRPC providers)
  (auth)/
    sign-in.tsx
    sign-up.tsx
  (app)/
    (tabs)/
      _layout.tsx             Bottom tabs: Home | Logs | Expenses | Settings
      index.tsx               Flocks list
      logs.tsx                All logs
      expenses.tsx            All expenses
      settings.tsx            Profile
    flocks/[flockId]/
      index.tsx               Flock dashboard
      edit.tsx                Edit flock
      summary.tsx             Monthly summary
      breeding.tsx            Breeding planner
    notifications.tsx
```

---

## Phase 3: Core Screens

### 3.1 Flocks List (Home)
- `trpc.flocks.getFlocks.useQuery()` → `FlatList` with flock cards
- "Add Flock" FAB → form bottom sheet
- Tap flock → `flocks/[flockId]`

### 3.2 Flock Detail (Dashboard)
- Replicate `useFlockDataAppDir` hook: 4 parallel tRPC queries
- ScrollView: Stats cards → Production chart → Expense chart → Breeds → Tasks
- FABs for "Log Eggs" and "Log Expense"

### 3.3 Charts (victory-native)
- **ProductionChart** → `VictoryLine` + target average overlay, 7/15/30 day range selector
- **ExpenseChart** → `VictoryStack` (bars by category) + `VictoryLine` overlay, 6/9/12 month selector
- Chart data helpers extracted to `packages/shared/chart-utils.ts`

### 3.4 Log Eggs Modal
- Bottom sheet with date picker, numeric count input, breed selector, notes
- `trpc.logs.createLog.useMutation()` + `trpc.useUtils()` invalidation

### 3.5 Log Expense Modal
- Bottom sheet with date picker, currency input, category picker, memo
- `trpc.expenses.createExpense.useMutation()`

### 3.6 Breed Add/Edit
- `react-hook-form` + `expo-image-picker` → Firebase Storage upload
- `trpc.breeds.createBreed/updateBreed/deleteBreed.useMutation()`

### 3.7 All Logs & All Expenses
- `FlatList` with pagination, flock filter, swipe-to-delete

---

## Phase 4: Secondary Screens

| Screen | Key Details |
|--------|-------------|
| Flock Edit | Form + image upload + delete with confirmation |
| Flock Summary | Monthly stats, `react-native-view-shot` for sharing |
| Tasks | Today/upcoming toggle, mark complete, recurring support |
| Notifications | List with mark-as-read, unread badge on header icon |
| Settings | Clerk UserProfile or custom via `useUser()` |
| Breeding Planner | Bird profiles, pair manager, pedigree tree (`react-native-svg`) |

Skip: Landing/marketing pages (web-only)

---

## Phase 5: Server-Side Changes

### CORS Headers
Update `apps/web/src/app/api/trpc/[trpc]/route.ts`:
- Add CORS headers: `Access-Control-Allow-Origin`, `Allow-Methods`, `Allow-Headers`
- Add OPTIONS handler for preflight requests

### Auth Verification
- Verify `getAuth(req)` works with Bearer tokens from Expo
- Fallback: `verifyToken()` from `@clerk/backend` if needed

---

## Phase 6: Build & Deploy

- **EAS Build**: `eas.json` with dev/preview/production profiles
- **Env vars**: `EXPO_PUBLIC_CLERK_PUBLISHABLE_KEY`, `EXPO_PUBLIC_API_URL`, Firebase config
- **Distribution**: Dev client → TestFlight/internal → App Store + Google Play
- **OTA Updates**: EAS Update for JS bundle changes

## Implementation Order
1. Phase 0 — Monorepo conversion (verify web still works)
2. Phase 1 — Shared packages
3. Phase 2 — Expo scaffold + auth + tRPC connection
4. Phase 5 — CORS + auth server changes
5. Phase 3.1-3.2 — Flocks list + flock detail (no charts yet)
6. Phase 3.3 — Charts with victory-native
7. Phase 3.4-3.7 — Modals + paginated lists
8. Phase 4 — All secondary screens
9. Phase 6 — EAS build + deploy

---

## Verification
- Web app still builds and deploys after monorepo conversion
- Mobile app authenticates via Clerk
- tRPC queries return data from mobile → server
- All CRUD operations work (flock, log, expense, breed, task)
- Charts render with real data
- Image uploads work via Firebase Storage
- EAS builds succeed for iOS and Android
